content.question: The student claims that the reaction is an oxidation-reduction reaction. Which of the following statements correctly describes a change in oxidation number as the decomposition reaction proceeds?

choices.label: The oxidation number of hydrogen changes from <math alttext="positive 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math> to <math alttext="positive 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

The oxidation number of hydrogen changes from <math alttext="positive 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math> to <math alttext="positive 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.

The oxidation number of oxygen changes from <math alttext="negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> to <math alttext="negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

The oxidation number of oxygen changes from <math alttext="negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> to <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math>.

content.answer: The oxidation number of oxygen changes from <math alttext="negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> to <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math>.
